"is/are watching" from 2 roots - daykhan ਦੇਖਣ s  and haaray ਹਾਰੇ s . The word "dayk" means "look/watch"; "daykhan" means "is/are looking/watching". "Haaray" means "doer" or "endower of" or "worthy of"  the suffix.
